intro: Hemiboea henryi var. guandongensis, commonly known as the Guangdong hemiboea, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and attractive, tubular flowers. The plant typically features glossy, ovate leaves and produces showy blooms in shades of red, orange, or yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
